title: S3-B2: Home page - Action buttons
description: Offer Help (green), Request Help, Essentials buttons with icons

title: S2-D: Messaging Threads
description: Thread model with types (help_match, item_reservation, direct). Message model with user/system types. 18 tests pass.

title: Sprint 1 Evaluation Complete - All Features Verified
description: Backend: 51/51 tests pass. Frontend: All 20 block components exist. ThemeProvider, ThemePresetSelector, BlockRegistry verified. APIs: organizations, theme-presets, templates all working.

title: S3-H1: CMS Page Editor
description: Admin page builder with visual block editor. Includes: admin layout/sidebar, page list view, template gallery, drag-and-drop block reordering, property editor for 20 block types, page settings (title/slug/status), publish workflow.

title: S2-E: Moderation System
description: Report model targeting users/posts/messages. ModerationAction with warn/remove/suspend/ban. Audit logging. 20 tests pass.

title: S5: User Onboarding Epic
description: User onboarding epic complete. 4 features implemented: Welcome Flow wizard, Philosophy Introduction, Profile Setup Wizard, and First Participation Prompt. All pages use consistent KapwaNet philosophy language and design patterns. Playwright tests created at tests/s5-onboarding.spec.ts (7 tests passing).

title: S5-A: Welcome Flow
description: Welcome flow wizard for new users with 4 steps: greeting, philosophy quotes, flow concepts, and ready state. Implemented at /apps/web/src/app/welcome/page.tsx with progress indicator, skip option, philosophy quotes carousel, and final call-to-action for first participation.

title: S5-B: Philosophy Introduction
description: Interactive philosophy introduction with 5 sections from The Flow prose. Implemented at /apps/web/src/app/onboarding/philosophy/page.tsx. Features reflection prompts, progress tracking, animated transitions, and links to full philosophy page. Sections: Before You Arrived, You Have Never Given, You Have Never Needed, The Traditions Knew, Only Participation.

title: S5-C: Profile Setup Wizard
description: Profile setup wizard with 4 steps: display name, about, interests selection, and completion. Implemented at /apps/web/src/app/onboarding/profile/page.tsx. Features 8 interest categories (meals, transport, childcare, eldercare, skills, education, wellness, goods), API integration for profile updates, and localStorage for interests.

title: S5-D: First Participation Prompt
description: First participation prompt encouraging users to take their first action. Implemented at /apps/web/src/app/onboarding/first-action/page.tsx. Three options: Open a space (create invitation), Let something flow (share gift), or Just explore. Philosophy-aligned language throughout with confirmation screen before action.

title: S3-B3: Home page - Community Pulse carousel
description: Horizontal scrolling story cards showing recent community activity

title: S2-B: Help Posts & Matching
description: HelpPost model with request/offer types, urgency levels, status flow. HelpMatch for express interest and accept match. 35 tests pass.

title: S6: Platform Enhancements
description: Sprint 6 covering notifications, admin/moderation, PWA enhancements, and backend improvements.

title: S6-A: Notifications System
description: In-app notification center with bell icon, notification list, mark as read, and real-time updates.

title: S6-B: Activity Feed
description: Live activity feed showing community actions - new posts, matches, completions. Real-time updates with polling or WebSocket.

title: S6-C: Admin Dashboard
description: Admin dashboard with user management, content moderation queue, reports management, and community analytics.

title: S6-D: PWA Enhancements
description: Progressive Web App improvements - offline support, install prompts, background sync, and service worker updates.

title: S6-E: Search Functionality
description: Global search across posts, users, and content. Search bar in header, filters, and results page.

title: S6-F: Image Upload
description: Profile avatar upload and post image attachments. Image preview, resize, and storage integration.

title: S3-E1: Authentication pages
description: Authentication pages - Login and Registration. IMPLEMENTATION: apps/web/src/app/login/page.tsx (login form with demo credentials), apps/web/src/app/register/page.tsx (registration with password validation, philosophy quote). TESTS: tests/s3-features.spec.ts

title: S3-A2: Mobile-first layout shell
description: AppShell with sticky header, floating bottom nav (Home, Explore, Add, Chat, Profile)

title: S1-C: Block Renderer (20 blocks)
description: All 20 block components exist: Hero, RichTextSection, CardGrid, Steps, CTABanner, ContactBlock, AnnouncementBanner, ImageTextSplit, StatsStrip, FAQAccordion, TestimonialQuote, NewsList, TeamGrid, PartnerLogos, NeedsWidget, SponsorStrip, DonateWidget, VolunteerRoles, EventList, ResourceLinks. BlockRegistry and BlockRenderer also present.

title: S3-D2: Post detail page
description: Post detail pages for viewing single posts. IMPLEMENTATION: apps/web/src/app/invitations/[id]/page.tsx and apps/web/src/app/gifts/[id]/page.tsx - Detail views with actions.

title: S3-E2: Profile page
description: User info, my posts, settings, logout, org membership

title: S3-C2: Offers marketplace page
description: Gifts marketplace page with category filters. IMPLEMENTATION: apps/web/src/app/gifts/page.tsx - Grid layout with image cards, condition badges, filtering by type and category.

title: S3-F1: KapwaNet landing page
description: KapwaNet public landing page. IMPLEMENTATION: apps/web/src/app/(marketing)/landing/page.tsx - Hero section, feature cards, how it works, org CTA. TESTS: tests/s3-features.spec.ts

title: S3-F2: Organization onboarding flow
description: Organization onboarding wizard. IMPLEMENTATION: apps/web/src/app/organizations/new/page.tsx - 3-step wizard (basics, customize, invite). TESTS: tests/s3-features.spec.ts

title: Core Philosophy & Design Language
description: Developed KapwaNet core philosophy rooted in kapwa and wisdom traditions. Created design philosophy document integrating lessons from research. Defined language reframing: Needs→Invitations, Offers→Gifts, Help→Participate. Established principles: remove shame, remove friction, remove ego, care for coordinators.

title: S4: Kapwa Experience Roadmap
description: Implement kapwa-centered design philosophy across the platform. Phases: 1) Remove Shame, 2) Remove Friction, 3) Remove Ego, 4) Coordinator Care, 5) Reach the Unreachable.

title: S4-A: Language Reframing
description: Apply kapwa language throughout UI. Needs→Invitations, Offers→Gifts, Help→Participate, Request→Invite. Update navigation, buttons, status labels, empty states.

title: S4-B: Anonymous Invitations
description: Allow posting invitations without revealing identity. Add 'Show my name' toggle (default off). Display as 'A neighbor invites...' when anonymous.

title: S4-C: Optional Descriptions
description: Make description field optional on invitations. Add prominent skip button. 'I need [category]' is enough.

title: S4-D: Collective Impact Counter
description: Show community-wide impact metrics on home page. 'This month: 47 meals shared, 12 rides given.' No individual rankings.

title: S4-E: Reciprocity Visibility
description: Show gentle reciprocity indicator in profile. 'Received 3 times, Gave 2 times.' Private, not public. Remind that the gift flows both ways.

title: S4-F: Coordinator Dashboard
description: Dashboard for coordinators to see all open invitations, load distribution, burnout alerts. 'You've handled 12 this week - can someone else take the next one?'

title: S3-A1: Design system update (KapwaNet green theme)
description: Update Tailwind with green primary #73c91d, earthy tones, Plus Jakarta Sans font, Material icons

title: S2-A: Membership & Invite
description: Membership model with roles (org_admin, moderator, member) and status (active, suspended, left). Invite flow with token/expiry. All tests pass.

title: Sprint 2 Evaluation Complete - All Tests Pass
description: All 161 Django tests pass. Help: 35 tests, Items: 37 tests, Messaging: 18 tests, Moderation: 20 tests, Organizations: 51 tests. All API endpoints require authentication as expected.

title: S3-B1: Home page - Hero section
description: Welcome greeting, hero card with background image, 'Strength in shared identity' headline

title: S3-G1: Chat/Messages page
description: Chat/Messages page with thread list and message view. IMPLEMENTATION: apps/web/src/app/messages/page.tsx - Thread list, message thread view, compose. TESTS: tests/s3-features.spec.ts

title: Sprint 3: Frontend UI & KapwaNet as a Service
description: Build mobile-first community UI based on design mockups. Position KapwaNet as a deployable platform for community organizations.

title: S3-D1: Create post page
description: Create post page for invitations and gifts. IMPLEMENTATION: apps/web/src/app/create/page.tsx - Dual-mode form (help/item), type toggle (offer/request), anonymous posting, validation.

title: S1-D: Template Library
description: TemplateLibrary model and API endpoint verified. Templates retrievable via /api/templates/.

title: S1-A: Organization & Theme Models
description: Backend models verified: Organization (UUID, slug, name, region, logo_url), OrgTheme (theme_json JSONField), ThemePreset (5 presets seeded). All CRUD operations tested.

title: S3-C1: Needs feed page
description: Invitations list/feed page with filters for type and urgency. IMPLEMENTATION: apps/web/src/app/invitations/page.tsx - Full feed with filtering, loading states, empty states, and card components.

title: S1-B: Styling Engine Frontend
description: ThemeProvider context with CSS variable injection, useTheme/useThemeStyles/useIsDarkTheme hooks, ThemePresetSelector component. All verified.

title: S2-C: Item Posts & Reservations
description: ItemPost with food safety fields (expiry, allergens, storage). ItemReservation flow with approve/reject/pickup. 37 tests pass.
